moves.3. e5 d6 4. exd6 exd6 5. Nf3 Nf6 6. Qe2+: didnt want to exchange the queens
moves.7. Qb5+ Nbd7: although giving up a pawn, black position is solid and the white queen is going to be forced back soon
moves.8. Qxb7 Bd5 9. Qb4 Nb6 10. Qb5+ c6 11. Q: Black has complete control of the center, pieces developed and ready to attack the white king
moves.15... Bxf3 16. Rg1 Ng4 17. c3 Nxh2 18. Q: with 1 piece up, happy to exchange queens
moves.34. Kh4 Nxh1 35. Rxh1 Rxb2 36. Ra1 Ra3 3: white should resign. It is only a question of time
